medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 14 with an 'ingrown scalp hair'. Initially sporadic and brief episodes of hair pulling progressed to numerous daily episodes lasting several hours. Symptoms worsened before menses, during confinement, stress, and upsetting situations.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of motor tics and intermittent repetitive behaviors, including nail biting and skin picking. Some childhood counting rituals but no significant distress.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes severe nail biting and skin picking in the mother, skin picking by the sister, and a maternal grandfather with rocking behavior. A nephew diagnosed with motor tic disorder and trichotillomania.
medical_history.social_history: Engaged when first evaluated. No history of smoking or substance abuse. Very light alcohol and caffeine consumption.
